results.title: Modern surgery
results.creator_credit: March of Time, Inc. and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description: Discusses the resources and techniques of the modern hospital. Follows the case history of Mrs Conrad whose urgent need of an operation was a cause of consternation and fear. She receives advice and assurance from her family physician, enters hospital and finds herself in skilled hands.

results.title: Men of Medicine
results.brief_description: Follows a young physician through some of the problems facing the young doctor today - successfully meeting the medical needs of his community, and winning the confidence and respect of the people. Discusses how the benefits of modern medicine can be made available to all.

results.title: Life with junior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A typical day in the life of a ten-year-old, presenting such common problems as the acceptance of a new brother and the refusal to eat. Emphasises the anxieties of parents over guiding their children in today’s world, and explains ways in which to cope with behaviour problems.

results.title: Life with grandpa
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
The problems of old age as they affect people in the United States - achievements of medical science in forestalling disease, controlling dangerous ailments earlier in life; with a longer life expectancy, an increasing population of old people; ways of combating prejudices against employing old persons. Some notable personalities of advanced years including Sir Winston Churchill, Dorothy Dix and George Bernard Shaw.

results.title: Life with baby
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
How children grow mentally and physically has been studied during the past 35 years by a group of specialists working under the direction of Dr Arnold Gesell at the Yale University Clinic of Child Development. They have been able to establish definite standards of development for children up to six years of age. Many of these findings are illustrated in this film. Non-technical in character, the film aims at a better understanding of the young child by adults and older children.

results.title: Golden Twenties
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A chronicle of America’s Jazz Age based on a study of the 1920’s by Frederick Lewis Allen and Samuel Wood Bryant. Over 150 famous people appear, including the Prince of Wales, H.G. Wells, Thomas Edison, Woodrow Wilson, Charles Lindbergh and Al Capone. Famous sporting personalities and entertainers are presented including excerpts from feature films of the era starring Rudolp Valentino, Al Jolson and Greta Garbo among others. Edited by Leo Zochling.

results.title: The Fight game
results.creator_credit: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: A survey of boxing from the days when the rules were first formalised, to the present use of boxing by groups working wiht boys to give them healthful recreation and to channel their energies away from socially destructive practices. Includes scenes of Gane, Nelson, Dempsey, Tunney and Louis. The film closes with an examination of racketeering and other ills afflicting the sport and their possible cure.

results.title: Fight for better schools
results.creator_credit: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: How one American locality took up the fight for better schools. Statistics point to the general problems faced by America, which are exemplified by conditions in Arlington County, Virginia. Citizens there who became alive to the weaknesses of the local education system met only indifference until they showed the overcrowding and lack of facilities. Their action led to the election of new committees, new schools, new facilities and programs, and better pay for teachers.

results.title: Fashion means business
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
This film highlights the fashion industry in America. Top designers in New York and Paris are shown at work and a survey of America’s garment district gives some idea of the enormous size of the industry.

results.title: The Family: an approach to peace
results.brief_description: Shows that the only way to peace is in the understanding of other peoples, and contrasts the popular conception of foreign lands with life as it actually is around the globe. Through scenes of everyday family life everywhere, describes the similarity of the fears and aspirations of all people.
